sn46.21:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn46.21:5.2: How are the awakening factors defined?”
sn46.21:5.3: “Mendicant, they’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.
sn46.21:5.4: A mendicant develops the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.21:5.5: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.21:5.6: They’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.”
